definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent

sentences.english: Because she is a Fallen Angel.
sentences.chinese: 因爲她是墜入凡間的天使。

sentences.english: But it is the divine consciousness that connects earth with Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 但是隻有聖潔純粹的意識才能把凡間和天堂相連接。

sentences.english: There is so much suffering in this world.
sentences.chinese: 世界是一個凡間，歷來如此。

sentences.english: After 4 people arrive between every, to be not discovered by day group, cannot reoccupy theurgy.
sentences.chinese: 四人到凡間後，爲了不被天界發現，不能再用仙術。

sentences.english: After know earth required to return to glory.
sentences.chinese: 榮知道後要求返回凡間。

sentences.english: When a man is near death he loses interest in mundane affairs.
sentences.chinese: 當人即將死亡時，他對凡間的事務即失去興趣。

sentences.english: They are all dissociating the ordinary love and belong to men's sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 他們都遊離於凡間的情愛之中，都歸宿於男人的情懷。

sentences.english: It drives out of this world a god who had come into it with dissatisfaction and a preference for futile sufferings.
sentences.chinese: 它將那個帶來不滿和無謂苦難的神祗逐出了凡間。

sentences.english: It is the simplest thing in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世界是一個凡間，歷來如此。

sentences.english: The dragon came to women to seduce them when their husbands were gone.
sentences.chinese: 這些龍趁男人們不在，來到凡間勾引婦女。

definition: mundane world (in religious context)/this mortal coil
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to chat with a low voice
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
